text.0: now may our sweetest song with deep devotion reach varuṇa mitra aditi and bhaga.
text.1: may the five priests lord dwelling in oblations blissgiving asura hear whose paths are open.
text.2: may aditi welcome even as a mother her dear heartgladdening son my song that lauds her.
text.3: the prayer they love blissgiving godappointed i offer unto varuṇa and mitra.
text.4: in spirit him the sagest of the sages with sacrificial oil and meath bedew him.
text.5: so then let him god savitar provide us excellent ready and resplendent treasures.
text.6: with willing mind indra vouchsafe us cattle prosperity lord of bays and pious patrons.
text.7: and with the sacred prayer by gods appointed give us the holy deities lovingkindness.
text.8: god bhaga savitar who deals forth riches indra and they who conquer vṛtras treasures.
text.9: and vāja and Ṛbhukṣan and purandhi the mighty and immortal ones protect us.
text.10: let us declare his deeds the undecaying unrivalled victor whom the maruts follow.
text.11: none of old times o maghavan nor later none of these days hath reached thy hero prowess.
text.12: praise him the chief who gives the boon of riches bṛhaspati distributor of treasures.
text.13: who blessing most the man who sings and praises comes with abundant wealth to his invoker.
text.14: tended bṛhaspati with thy protections the princes are unharmed and girt by heroes.
text.15: wealth that brings bliss is found among the givers of horses and of cattle and of raiment.
text.16: make their wealth flee who through our hymns enjoying their riches yield us not an ample guerdon.
text.17: far from the sun keep those who hate devotion the godless prospering in their vocation.
text.18: with wheelless chariots drive down him o maruts who at the feasts of gods regards the demons.
text.19: may he though bathed in sweat form empty wishes who blames his sacred rite who toils to serve you.
text.20: praise him whose bow is strong and sure his arrow him who is lord of every balm that bealeth.
text.21: worship thou rudra for his great good favour adore the asura god with salutations.
text.22: may the housefriends the cunninghanded artists may the steers wives the streams carved out by vibhvan.
text.23: and may the fair ones honour and befriend us sarasvatī brhaddiva and rākā.
text.24: my newest song thought that now springs within me i offer to the great the sure protector.
text.25: who made for us this all in fond love laying each varied form within his daughters bosom.
text.26: now even now may thy fair praise o singer attain idaspati who roars and thunders.
text.27: who rich in clouds and waters with his lightning speeds forth bedewing both the earth and heaven.
text.28: may this my laud attain the troop of maruts those who are youths in act the sons of rudra.
text.29: the wish calls me to riches and wellbeing praise the unwearied ones whose steeds are dappled.
text.30: may this my laud reach earth and airs midregion and forest trees and plants to win me riches.
text.31: may every deity be swift to listen and mother earth with no ill thought regard me.
text.32: gods may we dwell in free untroubled bliss.
text.33: may we obtain the aśvins newest favour and gain their healthbestowing happy guidance.
text.34: bring riches hither unto us and heroes and all felicity and joy immortals.
